section.title: Features added and issues fixed in version 4.1.1

listitem.para: JBDS-1806: Validation within the BPEL editor would not show malformed XML and unknown extensions as errors. This would cause code to fail without prior warning. In this release these issues are correctly flagged as validation errors in the BPEL editor, allowing for prior warning before publishing the code.

JBIDE-3727: When editing the name of a node in source view (and more than one node is present), performing backspace or delete actions would not work correctly, missing characters and when typing a new name it would appear backwards. These issues have been corrected in this release by using the org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display class and updating semantic element variables to be final. The results from editing node names is now as expected.

JBIDE-9103: When creating a JSF portlet project on a 64bit operating system, the Installing JSF Facet process would hang and project creation would fail. This issue has been corrected by modifying the AbstractLibraryProviderInstallOperationConfig.java file by implementing a facet project listener and correcting an error of an extra bracket in a section of code.

JBIDE-9013: An issue existed that would not allow the Seam Portlet example to be deployed to JBoss Enterprise Portal Platform (EPP) 4.3. The problem was caused by a change in how Web Tools Platform (WTP) deployment is undertaken. Where this used to be done through the Java build path, WTP now deploys source folders based on the WTP component.xml file. The example has now been updated to support this change.

JBDS-1818: Drools libraries were upgraded in Enterprise Application Platform 5.1.1 and the Seam tooling did not take this into account. As a result, the Seam Project wizard needed to be updated to replace the JAR core.jar to be ecj.jar in the project classpath. This update has been applied in this release and allows the Seam Project wizard to use Drools libraries correctly.

TEIIDDES-1065: The Salesforce translator included with Teiid Designer has been upgraded from version 17 of the API to version 22. This update has also seen modifications made to the modelgenerator.salesforce plug-in to work correctly with the new API.

TEIIDDES-1064: When attempting to override a property on the translator, after saving the VDB and deploying it to the server, an error would occur informing VDB Not Deployed. The consequence of this was that a user had to manually copy the VDB to the server. To correct the issue Teiid Designer has been updated to validate a VDB against a list of translators that also include overrides. This ensures that a VDB that contains a translator override will still deploy correctly.

TEIIDDES-1058: When importing a VDB file into a different project than the one it was created in, a java.lang.IllegalArgumentException would occur upon double-clicking a model in the VDB Editor. To fix the issue a check for any null path values has been added prior to opening the editor. This ensures that the error is no longer seen and instead double-clicking a model within the VDB Editor that is not in the workspace will not produce any outcome.

TEIIDDES-1044: An interface error existed once the Dependency Diagram view had been opened that disallowed a user to return to the previous view. The consequence was that a user would have to close the model or search to find a way to go to another view. To correct the problem the ShowParentDiagramAction class is utilized through a new toolbar and context menu to allow a user a way to easily switch between views.

TEIIDDES-1042: The path to the ModeShape connection profile icon was incorrect, causing a red icon to appear in its place. The issue was fixed by correcting the path to the ModeShape icon within the correct plug-in.xml file.

TEIIDDES-1041: There was confusion with the Teiid driver called Teiid Preview Driver. The name of the driver allowed an assumption that it was only used when previewing a VDB, however it is also used when executing a VDB from the workspace. To better capture the role of the driver it has been renamed to Teiid Driver (default). This renaming also ensures that as a user creates their own driver instances it is easy to identify the default.

TEIIDDES-1039: The VDB dialog contained columns of defined widths causing some columns to need manual width adjustment in order to see all the text contained within it, while other columns contained nothing but were assigned a large allowance of space. To fix this usability issue the VdbEditor.java has been edited to utilize the getColumn().pack() command that adjusts column widths for best readability, depending on the text within them. By incorporating this change it ensures an improved user experience when using the VDB dialog.

TEIIDDES-1035: Within the Create Data Source wizard, the Connection Properties table contains a column called Data Source Name. The column should actually only be called Name. The column name has been changed in this version to ensure consistency across wizards.

TEIIDDES-1032: An error in the code when a web service data source was created meant that the Endpoint would not be set. This was because the Endpoint property was incorrectly named as WSUrl. Correcting this error within the IWSProfileConstants.java file has fixed the issue.

TEIIDDES-1026: A bug existed where only DBO schemas could be selected when importing from an SQL server using Import from JDBC. This meant that any other type of schemas in the server database could not be imported although they are supported by Teiid Designer. To correct the issue the code that asks for all the different schemas available in an SQL server database has been modified to allow for multiple types of schemas.

TEIIDDES-1017: A new feature has been added that allows for a Teiid Source file to be imported through an import wizard called Metadata from Teiid Metadata File. Once a source file is imported a relational model is generated that contains standard file connector procedures and a virtual model is created or selected for use that contains the file functions required by the table. For further information see the Teiid Designer User Guide for this release.

TEIIDDES-1016: Working towards the removal of the relationship metamodel, all non-essential user interface components have been removed and only the relationship diagram is now displayed. The relationship metamodel is being removed as it is no longer be used by Teiid or ModeShape.

TEIIDDES-1013: A bug existed where the RESTful properties of REST-METHOD and URI that are required for RESTful procedures required the names to be all upper-case. This caused errors when users would provide these properties but not all letters were upper-case. Resolving this issue has seen the modification of the ModelObjectAnnotationHelper and GenerateRestWarAction classes to check that the properties exist regardless of the case-type used.

TEIIDDES-992: A new feature has been added that allows the use of Pushdown functions without Java programming. A Pushdown function refers to SQL code that contains a function call as part of the final query, acts upon the actual source or database and is exposed in Teiid Designer as a Source Function (a function that exists or is known by a database source).
The addition of this feature ensures that creating a Pushdown function is simpler than it was before, improving usability.

TEIIDDES-990: Previously generated RESTEasy WARs accepted only a Uniform Resource e Identifier (URI) and XML parameters and produced only XML. JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) support as input and output has been added for this release and the URI for JSON methods contain json (for example, http://host:port/warname/modelname/json/pathinfo). To utilize XML instead, remove json from the path.

TEIIDDES-982: If a SOAP EndPoint was entered for a connection profile it would cause a connection error when exiting the dialog. The error occurred because the key value for the EndPoint was incorrect and never added to the TeiidDataSourceProperty object, which meant the connection could not be referenced correctly. This issue has been corrected through the modification of the SOAPConnectionInfoProvider class to correctly contain the EndPoint value and add it to the TeiidDataSourceProperty object for later recall by the connection.

TEIIDDES-981: An enhancement has been made to the Preview Data action that asks if a user wants to enable the preview preference and if they wish to create a server (if one does not already exist). The Deploy action has also been updated to ask a user if they wish to create a server, if one does not already exist. These enhancements improve the user experience for Teiid Designer.

TEIIDDES-972: New behavior has been implemented when a user imports a model that already exists. Previously importing an existing model would result in a warning message noting that it exists and the update checkbox would not be checked. For this release the behavior has changed so that the update checkbox is checked by default. This change ensures that the Import wizard works as expected.

TEIIDDES-971: When a user imported a table with one or more foreign keys, all tables with matching primary keys would also be imported. This could mean that when only one table was necessary, an import could also bring in numerous unnecessary tables for what the user wished to do. In order to allow for a table to be imported regardless of foreign key relationships, an option has been added to the Import Database wizard where a user can select to not import tables that have an incomplete foreign key and primary key relationship amongst the tables selected for import. By allowing the user to make this decision, the number of unnecessary tables that are imported is decreased.

TEIIDDES-965: The ability to generate a WAR archive with Message Transmission Optimization Mechanism (MTOM) support has been added for generated SOAP web services. A user can now avoid manually modifying a generated WAR archive to contain MTOM support by generating one that does, straight from the tooling.

TEIIDDES-958: A new menu item has been added under Metadata called Show SQL Reserved Words. By clicking on this option a new view will open in the workspace that allows a user to search and see if a word they wish to use is within the reserved words list. By exposing this list to the user to makes it easier to identify a reserved word.

TEIIDDES-843: The Build XML Documents from XML Schema dialog was larger than necessary, obscuring content below it. To correct this design error the left width hint has been modified within the AccumulatorPanel file. This allows for improved size judgment, reducing the dialog size.

TEIIDDES-597: An issue in the TableNotificationHandler class caused inserted rows of a relational column to appear in reverse order within the table editor. This meant that the tree view and table editor displayed the rows in inconsistent ways. The issue has been corrected by modifying the TableNotificationHandler.java file so that rows inserted are displayed correctly within the table editor. This results in both the tree view and table editor displaying the information in the same way.

TEIIDDES-369: A new feature has been added that places a green arrow beside any objects that are previewable by a user. The implementation of this new feature ensures that a user does not need to click an object to identify if performing the click action will do anything.

TEIIDDES-332: When creating a new virtual procedure a user was required to remember to insert prologue and postlogue code into the transformation editor. This allowed for common mistakes to occur when a user forgot to insert the correct code. For ease of use prologue and postlogue code is now inserted into the transformation editor automatically when creating a new virtual procedure. The change has reduced the amount of code required to be display on screen and created an improved user experience.

JBDS-1710: When using a WSDL (Web Service Definition Language) file to create a new web service, the wizard would not work correctly if the WSDL file contained similar wording to an error that can be generated by the component. By modifying the code within the AbstractGenerateCodeCommand class that checks for non-compilation errors from searching for errors based on error: instead of only error, it allows for the word error to now appear in a WSDL without causing issue. Using a WSDL file to create a new web service now works as expected.

JBIDE-9516: When creating a Sample RESTful Web Service, the wizard referenced a JAR file that did not exist and an error would occur. The issue has been fixed by ensuring that the wizard looks for a file that has a name starting with jaxrs-api and ends with .jar. This also allows for the JBoss Developer Studio to automatically use newer versions of the the file in the future.

JBIDE-9514: Project Example ZIP files that contain empty folders, would not be imported correctly and the empty folders would be excluded, though they are necessary for the project to work (for example, the src folder). To fix this issue the NewProjectExamplesWizard.java has been modified to allow for empty folders within ZIP files to be imported correctly.

JBIDE-9381: An issue existed that meant the runtime detector did not detect the SOA 5.2 runtime correctly, instead displaying it as 5.1. Correcting this issue has seen the modification of JBossASHandler.java to also include 5.2 as a runtime display option, and using the implementation and version properties from run.jar.

JBIDE-9361: When importing a project, if it is not faceted or does not contain a primary runtime, the project will not be imported correctly. This could have lead to errors being displayed and projects referencing an incorrect runtime. The issue has been corrected within this release by updating the WTPRuntimeFix.java by adding in code to check and handle when a project is not faceted or does not contain a primary runtime.

JBIDE-9344: When a user would import a project ZIP file using the project example framework, an empty sub-folder would appear that was unnecessary. This issue has been corrected in this release by modifying the NewProjectExamplesWizard.java file to check the files being imported and ensure the empty sub-folder no longer appears.

JBIDE-9009: The option to create a WAR archive would produce an error and the archive would not be created. The user interface menu item to auto-create a WAR archive has been removed from this release.
JBIDE-8919: A new feature has been added that allows for the ESB Runtime within the JBoss Service Oriented Architecture Platform to be separately identified and defined for individual use.

JBIDE-7052: An error existed where the optional dependency of org.hibernate.eclipse would not be resolved correctly within the BIRT component file ConsoleConfigurationOdaFactory.java. This caused any import of the plug-in to fail. The issue has been corrected by setting the org.hibernate.eclipse plug-in as required within the BIRT plug-ins MANIFEST.MF file.
